content:
In this PR, I proved that any Profinite group is the projective limit of finite groups.
8a3637d141959e8084d63373e39cb01.jpg
The dependency graph is above. Including 6 PRs in total.

60dfa0436d29869bd7cec02af5dac72.jpg
Dependency grapgh of all the PRs related.
#16976 #16977 #16978 #16979 #16980 and # 16991 have no dependency.

Asking for review of PR :
#16976 #16977
#16980 #16981
#16991 #16992
Thank you.

There is no need to ask for all those reviews. It will happen. This channel is useful when there is too much to discuss for GitHub or when a PR seems forgotten (say after three weeks without any activity).

Slightly contrary to what Patrick says, if you have particular people in mind who you are collaborating with on a subject area, it is fine to use this channel to ping them to discuss PRs, as soon as the PR is up.
I don’t think this contradicts what I wrote.

@Kevin Buzzard I think that @Nailin Guan took care of all your comments, and I'd be OK to write maintainer merge. But since you did a lot of review on this, I think you're the best maintainer to hit the button if you deem it appropriate.
Ok, I'm a bit snowed under with usual activities plus running Lean Together (sorting out videos etc) but I'll try to have a look ASAP
My memory was that it was pretty much ready
Yes, IMHO it is ready to go.

I remembered that there is still one problem not entirely resolved : The use of show in the theorem denseRange_toLimit. The original author of this code found that setting up two lemmas about forget2 would make it work in the current ProfiniteGrp:
5351fbe7dd44a313d0fc930f28ecce0.png
however there are two problems left:
1 : Is ther a way to write the two lemmas in a more general lemma? They somehow look alike but I am not familiar with the Bundled things.
2 : Can any body have a look about how to make it work after the refactor of the category ProfiniteGrp in #20740?
